creator: guruhitesh@gmail.com
text:
Steps to reproduce -

Open JMETER in GUI mode (version 2.9).
Open any sample test plan (My test plan has almost 15 thread groups)
In one of the thread group we have added the regular expression extractor.
If I select the regular expression extractor and click on help we are getting exception as "Uncaught Exception java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space."

However I have modified my JVM settings in my jmeter.bat and jmeter files as mentioned below

set HEAP=-Xms2048m -Xmx2048m
set NEW=-XX:NewSize=256m -XX:MaxNewSize=256m

After doing the above changes also I am getting this exception.

Also received below error message on my command prompt

2013-04-04 12:14:42.667 java[3285:f07] JavaNativeFoundation error occurred obtaining Java exception description

creator: guruhitesh@gmail.com
text:
I am using the JAVA version mentioned in the comment. 

Did you have the opportunity to test with a fresh install ? - COuld you please guide me which file should I install. I have installed the binary file (zip). If I download and install the Source file and start jmeter, its throwing an error Unable to access jarfile ./ApacheJMeter.jar.

Finally can you double check your PermSize setting ? - Where should I check this? 

I was able to reproduce the error on one of my colleagues machine.

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Can you attach  jmeter.log file ?

Also in jmeter file can you find this:
DUMP="-XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError"
and replace it by:
DUMP="-XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError -XX:HeapDumpPath=<choose a folder>"

Restart JMeter and when OOM will occur a file will be generated in <choose a folder>, zip it and try to send me though some download service

Load attached Test Plan and make a screenshot of Properties values.

Finally  what is the type of machine of your colleague ?

Thank you for your help

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
1) Can you try installing JDK7 from Oracle to see if it works better ?
2) Do you have a crash when you choose Options > Function Helper Dialog > Click on Help Button ?
3) Were you able to provide a Heap Dump ?

Thank you

creator: guruhitesh@gmail.com
text:
I have followed the process suggested to save the heap dump, but I have not seen any Heap dump getting saved in the chosen folder.
I am also facing the same issue in version 2.6
I have upgraded my jdk verion to jdk7
I am not facing any crash issue when I choose Options > Function Helper Dialog > Click on Help Button ?

Kindly help.

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Are you facing the issue when using jdk 7 ?

Try downloading again From here :
- http://jmeter.apache.org/download_jmeter.cgi
The binary file called:
- apache-jmeter-2.9.zip
Unzip it in new folder and test again with jdk6 and jdk7.

Thanks

Closing the bug as it seems to me related to a bad install of JAVA on your system.
And we are not getting required information to go further.

If you are able to provide required elements feel free to reopen and we will be happy to fix a potential bug.
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
